Lincoln City is approximately 2 hours southwest of Portland. There are two ways to get to Lincoln City from Portland, both of which take approximate the same amount of time:

value: Take I-5 south to Oregon 99W west in Tigard, then follow Oregon 18 west near McMinnville to its intersection with U.S. 101. OR
Take I-5 south to Salem Parkway in Salem. In downtown Salem, take Oregon 22 west to Oregon 18 west at Willamina. Follow Oregon 18 to U.S. 101.

Central Lincoln City is about 5 miles south on U.S. 101 from the junction with Oregon 18.
are the two nearest airports with scheduled service.

Catch a movie at the old Bijou Theatre

content=Seafood, Steaks, Deserts, Salads, Deserts and More. Live Entertainment. Located in Gleneden Beach.
content=Seafood - The bay house is a great restaurant for fine dining with excellent chefs and freshly caught seafood.

Seafood platters– The Blackfish café is also another places for fine dining but is a little bit more expensive than the bay house, but makes up for it with a great location in the northern part of town within walking distance of the beach
content=For a spectacular view of the ocean as your enjoy excellent food
- Its right on the beach with great sunsets and atmosphere. Get there early because they are always busy
– Mo’s is legendary for clam chowder and has the best view of the Siletz bay.
Serves a great hamburger that many can't eat in one sitting
Salishan Lodge and The Side Door Cafe
Fancy place at a high price
'''LaRoca Tino Huesca & La Hacienda Flores for some excellent Mexican cuisine. This restaurant is on the way to Depoe bay about ten minutes from Lincoln city just head south on Hwy 101
Indian and Nepalese foods as well as many American dishes
- Best pizza on the beach big parties welcome. Pizza Beer salad and chicken what else could you ask for. Also call for deliveries
The best and biggest homemade breakfast served on the coast since 1926. Breakfast served all day. A must when visiting the central Oregon coast.

content=Homestyle cooking with BIG servings and MODERATELY priced serving Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner 8AM-11PM Su-Th and until 3AM on Friday & Saturday.  Bar Menu and appetizers available.  Pool, Darts, full service lottery and 10 TV's in the Lounge.
content=Known and loved by many for clam chowder that blows the doors off Mo's and outstanding fish and chips.  Not fancy but always popular.
address=1500 SE East Devils Lake Rd

content=Famous for their Riptide Cheesy Caramel Corn they have over 32 flavors of taffy, an impressive variety of chocolates including Moonstruck Chocolates and a full Espresso Bar. Located in the Tanger Factory Outlet Mall.

There are many pubs in Lincoln City:

value: content=McMenamins pub where you can watch them brew the beer on site.
The Roadhouse is a great bar for live classic rock music on the weekend. With the traditional policy of throwing your peanut shells on the floor this is a great bar for young and old.

Maxwell’s is in the northern part of Lincoln city on 17th street and Hwy 101. This Restaurant & Lounge has karaoke 7 nights a week at 9PM with over 43,000 Titles and is open for food until 3AM Friday and Saturday. Restaurant open 8AM-11PM Su-Th.
The bar at this casino is a great attraction for the younger crowd dancing and new age music DJ’s on the weekend.

content=A small community cafe with a great menu.  Serving breakfast and lunch all hours.  Homemade food awaits in a clean, local atmosphere. Featuring Oat crusted french toast, hand pressed burgers with hand made buns.  Scotch Eggs, Breakfast "Poppers", Buttermilk pancakes, Homemade soups, salads, pulled pork BBQ and more.  Tables for 2-4 with a small loft area where larger groups (up to 10) can be accommodated.
content=Breakfast and lunch menu, served all day.
directions=Located One Street Over From Mo's Restaurant in Taft District

content=A Warm Friendly Cafe located in Taft District in Lincoln City Oregon.
Serving Breakfast and Lunch All Day- Closed Mondays Hours 7AM-3:00
Phone 541-996-3647

content=Offering Ocean Front Suites and pet friendly cottages.
content=The Inn at Wecoma is in the northern section of the town that was once known as Wecoma.
content=Near the beach and located in the Historic Taft District.
content=Interested in a unique motel? View the carvings in front.
address=1225 SE 1st St.,  Lincoln City, Oregon

content=Horizon Rentals offers Lincoln City vacation rentals on the Oregon Coast, including oceanfront, pet-friendly, oceanview, and lakefront rental homes and condos in Lincoln County and Tillamook County.
address=33105 Cape Kiwanda Drive Pacific City, Oregon

content=Shorepine Village offers fully furnished vacation rentals on the Oregon Coast.  Each beach home includes gas or wood fireplaces, fully equipped kitchens, barbecues, bikes, deck furniture, full size washer/dryers and more.  Accommodations range from 4 to 10 people, depending on the home. Miles of paved pathways lead to a unique wooden dune ramp, providing easy access to the beach and a wonderful vantage point for viewing breathtaking Pacific sunsets.

Go deep sea fishing or whale watching at near by Depoe Bay.
Go climb the stairs in the Yaquina Bay Lighthouse and then go visit the nearby Coast Guard Station and check out their equipment.
Visit the Tillamook Cheese Factory and sample some cheese curds and watch the cheese making process.
Take a trip in time and go see the
to visit the Spruce Goose, airplane of Howard Hughes.
Visit the wine valley and sample some Oregon wines east of Lincoln City.

Visit the dunes half an hour north in Pacific city. Ride quads, dirt bikes, or any other all terrain vehicle that you can fix up with some sand tires. Also go to the Pellican Pub with locally brewed beer and great food.
